title: Episode 12 - "Girlie Show"
guest_stars: Fran Drescher, Carol Channing, Alice Cooper
synopsis: Space Ghost pays tribute to "Women in the Entertainment Industry." First, actress Fran Drescher paralyzes Space Ghost with desire. Carol Channing dispenses motherly advice to soothe his troubled heart, but this comfort is ruined by the appearance of rocker Alice Cooper, who Space Ghost has mistaken for a woman.

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) Ah, let's see... ohhh, my thighs ache... (to camera) Oh dear.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Invisos in) Greetings, I'm Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Big whoop.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tonight, we present a special theme show, an all-star spectacular tribute to Women In the Entertainment Industry. (fanfare music in background) Our special guest women are "Nanny" Fran Drescher, that "Hello Dolly" herself Carol Channing, and horror rock and roll riot girl Alice Cooper. (aside to audience) It was my idea!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: My idea was much better! (light bulb appears above his head)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I told you, Zorak, we're not doing a musical tribute to Jack Klugman.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (light bulb disappears) But Klugman is terrific, Klugman is dynamite, Klugman is ... Klugman!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Enough, Zorak! (quietly) Didn't I give up on us appearing in women's clothing?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ugh! You bloody fool!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sore loser!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: British imperialist swine!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tax and spend democrat!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Jive turkey!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Big baby! Baby mantis!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in bib, baby voice) Am not!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anyway, it's my show, so what I say goes. And I say we salute women (fanfare).

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: How about a tribute to...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost & Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I heard that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Invisos to desk) Zorak, that wasn't my patented theme music.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm on strike! Stick it to the man! (holding sign which says "SPACE GHOST UNFAIR TO EVIL MANTISES LOCAL 251")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh uh, Zorak, this is a non-union show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Tough (cough) with your show, you (cough cough), I'm on strike! (sign now says "DESTROY ALL TALK SHOWS")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey pal, watch the gutter language! This is a woman's show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (cough)!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And speaking of women, Moltar has whipped up a little something on them. Roll it, boy!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (silhouette walks in front of screen) Focus!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (voice over) Down in front!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (handwritten titles, being moved by hands on screen) "S. Gost Presents" / "Tribute to Women"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, that's entertainment!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ugh..

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Time for our first woman. (to himself) Hope my breath's alright. (aloud) Welcome, Citizen Nanny! (screen lowers)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hi!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) Oooh, she's a little vixen!

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: But what did you say before the word "nanny"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why, I, cough, cough (face gets red) (voice in background sings: "Riccolo!") I, uh, said, Citizen Nanny?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Citizen, oh, "Citizen Nanny", oh, hi, how are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs, then sighs)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: You know, I'm having trouble, hearing...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) Okay. (throws lever) (sound becomes loud and distorted)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can you hear me now? Testing...

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: It's too loud!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry. Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Turn it down! It's too loud!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever again; screen goes black, then comes back; sound returns to normal)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: That's much better!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, I swear...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I know, sorry.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: I, I think that's better.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What? Jack?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: No, I'm deaf in one ear. (laughs) (other voice laughs in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) That voice! That bewitching voice!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That Nanny needs a lozenge! (voice in background sings: "Riccolo!")

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (looks puzzled, then laughs again)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nanny, may I ask you some questions, so I can hear more of your enchanting voice?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Um, well...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! I'm going to ask the pretty Nanny questions. (to himself) Steady boy, keep cool.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ask her about Klugman! (sign says "FREE JACK KLUGMAN")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) Palms sweaty... (aloud) Uh, tell the show about us, Nanny!

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Am I supposed to answer now?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Ask me the same question.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh dear. I can't! Besides, I forgot it!, er, um... (To himself) Think, Tad, think!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: How many times has Jack Klugman been on "The Twilight Zone"? (clock ticks in background)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (hold up three fingers) Three!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (Buzz!) Incorrect! Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, one? (Buzz!) Three! (Buzz!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sorry. Johnny! Tell them what they've won!

transcript.speaker: Johnny
transcript.dialogue: (picture of can zooms up on screen, with background music) They've won Diddley Squat! Yes, Diddley Squat, one size fits all, tons of uses. It's Diddley Squat. Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've got it! Nanny, do you nanny for radio-controlled robot children? (Buzz!) Oooh, dumb question.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Radio-controlled robot children? Uhhh, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let me try another question.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: You know, Arsenio Hall used to give out (buzz) nice gifts.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (nervous laugh) Nanny, please!

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (baby cries & dog barks in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We'll just let that one go since you're so adorable.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not you, Zorak! Sorry, Nanny, he's just jealous.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm not jealous, I'm on strike!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Man, he's annoying!

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: You obviously enjoy, um, being in that kind of love-hate relationship.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't love Zorak! I love... (harp music swells in background) (to himself) Can it be? Do I love the Nanny?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) (more baby cries, dog barks, set shakes, with crashing noise)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) Zuda lord, I do love the Nanny! I can feel it deep inside, in my icky stuff. Every fibre, every iota of my magnificent being feels it!

transcript.speaker: Gleep
transcript.dialogue: Gibber gibber gibber. (subtitle: I love the Nanny)

transcript.speaker: Gloop
transcript.dialogue: Gibber gibber gibber gibber gibber. (subtitle: Though I'm but an iota of Space Ghost's being... I too love this Nanny.)

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: (dramatic organ music) So, this Space Ghost fella tell that Nanny girl he loves her? Will the Nanny feel, you know, likewise? Will that bug meet that actor fella he always talks about? And the other one, what's with him, ah, who knows?
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey hey, ho ho, Space Ghost has got to go. (sign says "DESTROY ALL TALK SHOWS") (repeats chant in background while others talk)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to himself) After lunch, we'll marry, in a simple ceremony. She'll grow to love the Ghost Planet after a while... (Zorak continues to chant) (aloud) Don't mind him, dearest. Labor dispute.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: You can fire him, you're the star.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey hey, ... He can't fire me! I'm the hardest working mantis in show business! Hi-yo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Forget him, my fair Nanny! He's but a lowly proletariat.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Actually, I'm Episcopalian.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (lounge music in background) You know, I've never met a woman guest quite like you before, Nanny.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, I know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah, I can sense quality in a female of the species when I scan for it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (belches)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak! There's a Nanny present! Watch your mouth!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I... I can't. It's... too underneathy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) My husband says that...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Husband?

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry Nanny, but... good-bye.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (looking puzzled; screen zaps)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (melancholy violin music in background) Don't want no more of this cryin' game.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (taunting, in sing-song voice) Space Ghost loves the Nanny!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do not!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Tainted love!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) I wonder what lucky citizen is her husband.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Don't you know, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mr. Belvedere? (Buzz!) Mr. French? (Buzz!)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You've never heard of Nanny and the Professor!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No! No! It can't be true! (Fran Drescher's and Russell Johnson's images are superimposed over Space Ghost's head)

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Space man, space master...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: MOTHER!!!!

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: You getting it?

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: (sings) "Helloooo, Space Ghost, well helloooo, Space Ghost..."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ewww!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost! You got a Channing at three o'clock!

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (dejected) Oh. Hello Carol. I'm sorry, but I don't feel up to this right now. I'm a downy clowny.

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: Oh, please come out of yourself.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still dejected) Alright. I'll try. Carol, are you getting enough oxygen?

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: No, I haven't...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with anxiety) Oh, what's the use!? I'm a fifty-car pile-up of misery!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The Nanny dumped Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: How dare she, she was miffed, she was mad, she had gained ten pounds over the Christmas holidays, it was fruit cake.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've... I've never known love, Carol.

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: You haven't, Space Ghost? You'd be divine!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I want to know what love is!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Love is watching Jack Klugman!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is not!

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes it is! Also...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I want woman love!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You're pathetic. Be a man, be a Klug-man!

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: I think Space Ghost is strangely sweet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? Thanks! I'm glad we had this little talk, Carol. I feel more confident now!

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: Oh, Space Ghost, I've enjoyed it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Could I ask you to dinner after the show?

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: Oh, sure you could, we'd be cute together.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? We'd be cute? Say, would you go steady with me?

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Carol Channing
transcript.dialogue: Ta ta! (zaps off screen)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fine! Be that way! "Good-bye, Dolly!" Moltar! Next guest! (aside) I'll charm the pants off her. (aloud) Ladies and gentlemen, the lovely Alice Cooper! (Alice appears, exchanges looks with Space Ghost, who is clearly puzzled)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to our nightmare, Alice! (laughs with Moltar)

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Mr. Ghost, or is it Space?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're not a woman, are you?

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: Oh no, no, not me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But, but you have make-up on!

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: I was actually born with eye make-up on.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Achh! What the (Buzz!) is going on here?

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Has society totally broken down?

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: I think that we all, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is nothing sacred? Is love a lie?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost? I made you something. I think you need it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sniffs) What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: An ejector seat! Bonzai! (ejects Space Ghost through the ceiling into space)

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: (chuckles)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Heh heh... Good one, dude.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (outside in space, talking to himself) Game over, man, game over. (Asteroid hits his head) Oww!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (at Space Ghost's desk) Prepare yourselves for Klugman!

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eh, we're short on time here, Alice dear, so chop off your head, or eat a rat, or something, so we can wrap this up.

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: You know, actually, I've never ever bitten or killed anything on stage.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Cooper, how much to get rid of you?

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: Million five, after the show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Done and done. (cash register sound)

transcript.speaker: Alice Cooper
transcript.dialogue: See ya, creeps.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still outside, talking in John Wayne voice) No, Skinny, get away from that fence, Skinny.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sam! Roll Klugman!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Quince! (Jack Klugman is on control room monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still outside) Please, someone, anyone, tell me this is all just a horrible nightmare.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (Jack Klugman is on the studio monitor) No, it's not! Space Ghost's fifteen minutes of lame are up! Let the Klugman revolution begin! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Zorak & Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And now, Klugman, Klugman, Klugman, Klugman, Klugman!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good night, my little Nanny, wherever you are.

transcript.speaker: Fran Drescher
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)
